CONJUGATES: poetically (adv) | more poetic (comparative) | most poetic (superlative) | poetry (n) | poem (n) | poet (n)
ETYMOLOGY: From Late Latin poēticus, from Ancient Greek ποιητικός (poiētikós, 'creative, poetic'), from ποιητής (poiētḗs, 'poet'), from ποιέω (poiéō, 'I make, I create').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: An adjective is a word that describes or modifies a noun or pronoun.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Relating to or characteristic of poetry or poets; written or expressed in verse.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 与诗歌或诗人相关的；诗歌的；诗人的；用诗体写成的
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He writes in a very poetic style, using rich metaphors and imagery.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他以一种非常诗意的风格写作，运用了丰富的比喻和意象。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: An adjective is a word that describes or modifies a noun or pronoun.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Having an imaginative or sensitive quality appropriate to poetry; beautifully expressive.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 富有想象力或情感的；优美而富有表现力的；如诗如画的
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The sunset over the mountains was a truly poetic sight, inspiring awe and wonder.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 群山之上的日落景色如诗如画，令人心生敬畏和惊叹。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: An adjective is a word that describes or modifies a noun or pronoun.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (In the phrase 'poetic justice') an outcome in which vice is punished and virtue rewarded, often in an especially appropriate or ironic way.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （用于短语“poetic justice”）报应，因果报应（尤指善有善报，恶有恶报的恰当或讽刺性结局）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: It was a moment of poetic justice when the thief lost his own wallet trying to escape.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 小偷在试图逃跑时弄丢了自己的钱包，这真是一种“诗意的正义”。
